page.title: 03CROFTING ON SCORAIG
page.content: THERE IS A LARGE CROFT AT SCORAIG, CONSISTING OF OVER A HUNDRED ACRES.OF THOSE 35 ARE ARABLE,HALF AN ACRE GARDEN, SIX ACRES FORESTRY,AND THE REST ROUGH GRAZING. THE PRESENT CROFTER, WHO HAS LIVED THERE MOST OF HIS LIFE, TOOK OVER THE CROFT WHEN HIS FATHER,AN INCOMER,EMIGRATED TO TASMANIA. HE KEEPS OVER A DOZEN CATTLE, MOSTLY ABERDEEN ANGUS CROSS. HE GROWS SOME OF HIS OWN HAY,BUT HAS TO BUY IN MORE HAY AND CONCENTRATES TO FEED THEM OVER THE WINTER. HE HAS GOOD HANDLING FACILITIES, AND MANY OF THE OTHER CROFTERS BRING THEIR ANIMALS TO HIS CRUSH WHEN THE VET VISITS. HE HAS ABOUT 130 CHEVIOT BREEDING EWES.AGAIN, MOST OF THE OTHER CROFTERS BRING THEIR SHEEP TO HIS CROFT FOR DIPPING AND SORTING LAMBS. HE HAS 2 SHEEP DOGS.
